Description: Small complete scarab, made of beige steatite. Some details carved, brownish glaze, with incised lines. No details of the back are shown, except two short horizontal lines at the outer edge of the height between prothorax and elytra. The area of the head is quite stylized. Head but no eyes visible, clypeus shows five lobes. The plates are shown. The side shows only one incised line leaving a broader lower band without any indication of legs. The seal at the base shows an oval line framing the base. One line of hieroglyphs visible, from right to left: j - Pth (inversed) - nb (sideways).
